comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
It seems that it's caused by `Legitimate URL Shortener` filter list, so as a temporary solution, please add this rule:
```adblock
@@||cravesandflames.com/safe.php?link=*&referrer=$removeparam=referrer
```
to user rules.

<hr>

@DandelionSprout Could you please take a look?
To reproduce that issue, go to - [https://jnovels.com/tearmoon-empire-volume-11-epub/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fjnovels.com%2Ftearmoon-empire-volume-11-epub%2F) and click on the `VOLUME 11` link (marked on the screenshot below).

<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/29142494/58be7626-8a71-4612-9c7b-a2e9fed4d1d0)

</details>

It's caused by this rule:
```adblock
$document,removeparam=referrer,domain=~bolt.com|~f4map.com|~deviantart.com|~github.com|~discover.*|~vimeo.*|~123-reg.co.uk
```

comment.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DandelionSprout/adfilt/master/Alternate%20versions%20Anti-Malware%20List/AntiMalwareAdGuard.txt](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fraw.githubusercontent.com%2FDandelionSprout%2Fadfilt%2Fmaster%2FAlternate%2520versions%2520Anti-Malware%2520List%2FAntiMalwareAdGuard.txt) ### Comment > adguard extension fails to retrieve the list data. Once it is added to custom filters, clicking on "update lists" does not update this list. The list needs to be deleted and re-added manually in order to work. Not sure what causes this, the other custom filters I added work as intended. This does not happen on the android version, the current version (29December2023v2 as you can see in the screenshot I took) is correctly downloaded. issue.title: "AdGuard Tracking Protection" list breaks caching in uBlock Origin
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

2.0.65.39

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

all URLs

### Ad Blocking

EasyList

### Privacy

AdGuard Tracking Protection filter

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

This issue occurs in uBlock Origin, but it is quite major. Therefore I am creating an issue here aswell.  
For reference: [uBlockOrigin/uAssets/issues/21841](https://github.com/uBlockOrigin/uAssets/issues/21841)

Enabling the list "AdGuard Tracking Protection" disables caching for all websites, reloading them on every visit, including navigating through tab history.

I could not reproduce this behavior in the adguard extension for firefox, however I have never used it before so I may not have configured it correctly.

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition
